briefTitle: 2 Doses of Ferrlecit Versus Oral Iron to Treat Iron-deficiency Anemia in Peritoneal Dialysis Patients.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male or female, at least 18 years of age.
* Received maintenance peritoneal dialysis therapy for at least 4 weeks.
* Was expected to remain on peritoneal dialysis therapy for duration of study.
* Had predetermined low hemoglobin and transferrin saturation (TSAT) levels.
* Signed patient informed consent.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Had a predetermined serum levels of Ferritin and TSAT
* Pregnant or lactating.
* Had a serious concomitant medical disorder incompatible with participation in the study.
* Had a known hypersensitivity to Ferrlecit or any of its components.
* Unable to cooperate or comply with the protocol.

outcomeMeasures.title: Hemoglobin
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline to 1 week after the last oral iron dose or 2 weeks after the last sodium ferric gluconate injection

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Hematocrit (Hct)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline to 1 week after the last oral iron dose or 2 weeks after the last sodium ferric gluconate injection

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Transferrin Saturation (TSAT).
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline to 1 week after the last oral iron dose or 2 weeks after the last sodium ferric gluconate injection

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Serum Ferritin.
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline to 1 week after the last oral iron dose or 2 weeks after the last sodium ferric gluconate injection

outcomeMeasures.title: Responders by Treatment Group
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients were classified as responders to treatment if they had an increase in Hgb of at least 1.0 g/dL assessed at 2 weeks following the final administration of Ferrlecit or 1 week following the last dose of oral iron.
